reviewText:
Demon’s Crystals is a twin stick shooter. It has demon’s and well, crystals which you must collect in order to save the world. It’s a very simple yet fun top down shooter.

Graphics:

Even though the game has a top down view, the game looks gorgeous in my opinion. Colors and the art-style really stands out. There’s something about this type of graphics which really appeals to the eyes. I had no problems with performance in this game and I was constantly getting over a 100 FPS throughout the whole time I played the game.

Sound:

Music is okay, it’s nothing great but it’s not bad as well. I’d say it’s your average sound track. I think the music could be better.

Gameplay:

Gameplay is your average twin stick shooter. You have 4 characters to choose from at the start and can play the game on normal, hard or nightmare mode. Every character has their own unique weapons so you may want to test them all out and choose the one which suits your playstyle best. Gameplay itself is pretty simple, you use WASD to move around the map and right click to shoot. Where ever your cursor is at in the game the player will shoot there. There’s all sorts of enemies which attack you, zombies, evil trees, skeletons, bats, ghosts etc.

Your goal is to collect crystals and as you collect crystals you also level up. Throughout the levels upgrades and other power ups spawn randomly and you can collect these to make your levels easy. Most of your gun pickups give you different patterns and spreads of your bullets. Levels consist of waves (or Hordes as they’re called in-game) of enemies and you must kill them and collect the crystals. Some levels have you kill a certain number of enemies, so the missions vary from level to level.

There’s also a survival mode where you have to survive as long as possible. The game can also be played with friends so there’s also the co-op factor which can always be fun. A short video of the gameplay can be found below:

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=695898749

Graphics: 9/10
Sound: 6/10
Gameplay: 7/10
Overall: 8/10

Conclusion:

Very fun twin stick shooter. Graphics are beautiful in my opinion and gameplay is pretty fun as well. If you plan on playing this with friends, you will really enjoy it. I think the price to fun ratio is pretty good in this game, you’ll definitely get your money’s worth.

reviewText: Haven't played much yet, just gotten through a few levels - I'll add more to the review once I've experienced more.  what I have experienced so far, though, is a lot of fun!  The graphics, as you can see from the screenshots & trailer, are nice & colorful and have a great not-overly-serious whimsicailty to them, and the engine runs beautifully and without hitches.  The action is fast and frantic, with enemies closing in on all sides, big bunches of crystals to collect and plenty of colorful and varied powerups to keep things interesting!  Playing local multiplayer is a blast, and the levels and gameplay hold their own in singleplayer equally as well, which is important to me, since I can be more of a singleplayer gamer for the most part. There are four characters to choose from, and they gain experience through the stages for various actions, which means levelling up, which keeps me happy and coming back!  Control is tight and responsive, both for the gamepad (I use an Xbox 360 myself) or keyboard/mouse.  All said, I recommend without hesitation!  Gotta go now, want to get back to it - it's got that 'one more round' quality that we all know and love.  Give it a try!  Well done, developers!  Cheers!     -XT
